results.title: Lenin's secret files
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Time watch”.
‘Lenin’s secret files’ is part of an acclaimed investigative history series from the BBC which pursues new evidence and research of familiar historical events and figures. In this program the ethnic background, family, political ruthlessness and illness of Vladimir Illich Lenin, who, in 1917 led the Russian Revolution, are followed. It uses the personal archives of Lenin - which have only been accessible since the collapse of communism, to present a definitive portrait of one of history’s key figures.

results.title: The Adventures of the wishing chair
results.creator_credit: Jean Flynn, Abbey Home Entertainment and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Enchanted lands”.
A compilation of seven short animated stories from Enid Blyton’s Enchanted Lands series, “The Adventures of the wishing chair”. Let yourself be whisked away with Mollie, Peter and Jigs the Pixie on their amazing Wishing Chair to visit distant lands of magic, dreams and fantastical adventures. Meet some of the delightful, and not so delightful, characters along the way like Magician Greatheart, the Grabbit Gnomes and the playful Clown Gnomes. Beautifully animated with lots of colour, magic and movement. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The African trade
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Time watch”.
Between the sixteenth and nineteenth century, 12,000 million Africans were sold as slave labour. The sheer number of people made it the biggest example of forced migration. Accompanying a tour of African Americans tracing their painful past, this documentary postulates that the Trans-Atlantic slave trade was only made possible by the existence of a prolific slave trade already in Africa. This resulted in the formation of mutually beneficial partnerships between Europeans and Africans. Europe and America would benefit in the long term from the arrangement, but West Africa would be left with little, only a guilt which is often not acknowledged. Narrated by Josette Simon.

results.title: The Magic of the faraway tree. [Vol. 2] = More adventures at the faraway tree
results.creator_credit: Ben Turner, Abbey Home Entertainment and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Enchanted lands”.
A compilation of six short animated stories from Enid Blyton’s Enchanted Lands series, “The Magic of the faraway tree” featuring more fantastic adventures with Joe, Fran and Beth and their Faraway Tree friends. Be amazed in the land of Giants, careful in the land of Topsy Turvy where you might end upside down, and watch those magic spells in the land of Wizards. Excellent animation with lots of colour and movement. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Jules Verne's mysterious island; Marco Polo
results.creator_credit: Leif Gram, Walter J Hucker and Air Programs International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Storytime Collection”.
Features two classic children’s stories; JULES VERNE’S MYSTERIOUS ISLAND; five prisoners flee the American Civil War in a hot air balloon. They land on a mysterious island, blown by the storm winds across the Pacific Ocean. What is the cause of the inexplicable events that occur on the island and will the five prisoners live to find out? MARCO POLO; set in China in the year 1260, this animated production is based on the original Marco Polo journals. Marco Polo and his servant Ton-Ton travel from Venice to China on a mission to find the Kubla Khan.

results.title: Kidnapped; Robinson Crusoe
results.creator_credit: Leif Gram, Walter J Hucker and Air Programs International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Storytime Collection”.
Features 2 classic children’s stories. In “Kidnapped”, a Scottish orphan, David Balfour is betrayed by his wicked uncle, Ebeneezer, and kidnapped and sold into slavery. His motive is to guarantee Unk’s inheritance over David’s genuine inheritance. It’s up to David to prove that he is the true Master of Shaws and expose his uncle’s evil plot. This tape also includes Daniel Defoe’s classic tale of Robinson Crusoe, marooned on a Pacific Island and the exciting and dangerous adventures he has.
